ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] building on Mac OS X
ygData.msgSnippet: James, With OS X, optimized versions of blas and lapack are contained in the Accelerate framework that comes with the operating system.  You are right that

Subject: Re: [cantera] building on Mac OS X
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=44728387; y=AP6a7fe1jKi6kdqGcwcLFCpQAcIdkE4jvQJOxvltG_XU
X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

James,

With OS X, optimized versions of blas and lapack are contained in the 
'Accelerate' framework that comes with the operating system.  You are 
right that the configure script detects OS X, and skips building the 
blas and lapack libs from source code.  But it should also add 
'-framework Accelerate' to the compilation options.  Is it not doing 
this for you?  It works fine on my Mac, but perhaps some tweaks are 
still needed.  Perhaps I should make using the Accelerate framework 
optional.

Dave


On Aug 23, 2005, at 2:41 PM, jcs6a50 wrote:

> I tried building cantera on OS X, and found that the blas and lapack
> libs are not built.  In cantera-1.6.0/config/configure, there is a
> statement that effectively prevents lapack and blas from being build
> on OS X.
>
> If I remove this statement, the blas libraries build, but there are
> undefined symbols in them:
>
> _dgemv_
> _dgemm_
> _dtrsm_
> _xerbla_
> _dswap_
> _lsame_
> _dger_
> _dscal_
> _idamax_
> _s_cmp
> _s_copy
> _dtrmm_
> _s_cat
> _dtrmv_
> _s_paus
>
> Any thoughts?
>
> James
